member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a class, implements the to this class, in which calls to methods are processed asynchronously from a single thread, suppressing concurrency inside each instance of the target class.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorAttribute.OnInstanceConstructed
member.summary: Executed when the target instance gets fully initialized, i.e. just after all constructors have completed.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorDispatcher
member.summary: A dispatcher compatible with the threading model, with a message queue based on a ConcurrentQueue The queue itself is processed from the .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorDispatcher.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorDispatcher.BeginInvoke(System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Queues an action for asynchronous execution.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorDispatcher.CheckAccess
member.summary: Determines whether the current thread has access to the current dispatcher.
member.returns: true if the current thread can directly call methods of objects protected by the current dispatcher, or false if methods or must be used.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorDispatcher.Invoke(System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback,System.Object)
member.summary: Executes an action synchronously.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorDispatcher.MustYield(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the method should interrupt the processing of the message queue before the queue is empty.
member.param: Number of messages already processed by the current invocation of the method.
member.returns: true if the method should stop processing messages, false if it should continue.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorDispatcher.ProcessQueue
member.summary: Processes the message queue synchronously.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ActorDispatcher.ScheduleProcessQueue
member.summary: Schedules the execution of the , typically on a worker thread or in the . The default implementation uses the on platforms that have a thread pool, otherwise it schedules a new .

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.AmbientConcurrencyControllerContext
member.summary: A disposable cookie returned by .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.AmbientConcurrencyControllerContext.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.BackgroundAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a method, causes the method to execute in the background.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.BackgroundAttribute.IsLongRunning
member.summary: Specifies that the method is long-running and should be executed on its own thread, if that is supported on the target platform. If false, the method will be executed in the thread pool.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrencyControllerFactory
member.summary: Provides methods to create new instances of concurrency controllers.

member.summary: Creates a new concurrency controller for the reader-writer-synchronized threading model ().
member.returns: A new instance of the reader-writer-synchronized concurrency controller.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrencyControllerFactory.CreateReaderWriterSynchronizedController(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new concurrency controller for the reader-writer-synchronized threading model () and specifies whether the new controller should participate in deadlock detection.
member.param: Indicates whether the controller should participate in the deadlock detection algorithm.
member.returns: A new instance of the reader-writer-synchronized concurrency controller.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrencyControllerFactory.CreateSynchronizedController
member.summary: Creates a new concurrency controller for the synchronized threading model ().
member.returns: A new instance of the synchronized concurrency controller.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrencyControllerFactory.CreateSynchronizedController(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new concurrency controller for the synchronized threading model () and specifies whether the new controller should participate in deadlock detection.
member.param: Indicates whether the controller should participate in the deadlock detection algorithm.
member.returns: A new instance of the synchronized concurrency controller.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ConcurrencyControllerFactory.CreateThreadUnsafeController
member.summary: Creates a new concurrency controller for thread-unsafe threading model ().
member.returns: A new instance of the thread-unsafe concurrency controller.

member.summary: Determines whether the target method is invoked asynchronously or asynchronously.

member.returns: An implementation of wrapping the functionality of .

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.EntryPointAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a private or protected instance method, causes all threading model aspects (derived from to introduce runtime generation code.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ExplicitlySynchronizedAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a method or field, specifies that threading model aspects (derived from ) should ignore all verifications for this field or method.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.FreezableAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a class, implements the to this class. The aspect introduces the interface into the target class. After the method has been invoked, the object can no longer be modified, and can therefore be safely shared between several threads.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IActor
member.summary: Interface implemented by the aspect.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IActor.Dispatcher

member.summary: Specific definition of the for the .

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IActorController.Dispatcher
member.summary: Gets the for the current actor.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IActorDispatcher
member.summary: Augments the interface with an method, which is invoked after the actor constructor has been invoked.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IActorDispatcher.Initialize
member.summary: Indicates that the controller should start enforcing access. Before this method is invoked, the method should always return true, allowing any access to the object. This mechanism allows the actor constructor to have full access on itself.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IDispatcher
member.summary: Defines the semantics of a facility that executes actions synchronously or asynchronously, possibly on a different thread.

member.summary: Queues an action for asynchronous execution.

member.summary: Executes an action synchronously.

member.summary: Determines whether the method is supported.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IDispatcher.SynchronizationContext
member.summary: Gets the associated with the current dispatcher.

member.summary: Gets the that controls access to methods of the current object.

member.summary: Interface implemented by the aspect. Defines a method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IFreezable.Freeze
member.summary: Prevents the current object to be modified.

member.summary: Interface implemented by the aspect.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ImmutableAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a class, implements the to this class. The aspect introduces the interface into the target class. Immutable objects cannot be modified after the constructor exits.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ImmutableAttribute.OnInstanceConstructed
member.summary: Executed when the target instance gets fully initialized, i.e. just after all constructors have completed.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IReaderWriterSynchronized.Lock
member.summary: Gets the that has to be used to synchronize access to the current instance.

member.summary: Exception thrown by objects that have the or when an attempt is made to modify the object after it has been made read-only.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the default error message.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a given error message.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.PrivateThreadAwareAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a class, implement the into this class, in which the threading model of an object is determined by the parent it is assigned to in a parent-child relationship.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ReaderAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a method, specifies that the method requires read access to the object.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ReaderWriterSynchronizedAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a class, applies the model to this class and all derived class. Members of this class must then be annotated with attributes specifying the required access level (, , or ), otherwise build-time and run-time errors are emitted.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ReadOnlyThreadAwareAttribute
member.summary: Base class for aspects and .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ReadOnlyThreadAwareAttribute.Advise(System.Object)
member.summary: Injects the advice into the child object.
member.returns: true if the children of have to be advised as well, false otherwise.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ReentrantAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that means that the async method to which it is applied can be safely re-entered on each await statement. In case of lock-based models, it means that the lock is released while awaiting. For the actor model, it means that other methods can be invoked during awaiting.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.RequiresThreadSafeAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a field, property or parameter, checks that the assigned object is thread safe. Otherwise, the assignment results in an /

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.SynchronizedAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a class, implements the into this class. In a synchronized object, only a single thread can access the object at a time. If a second thread needs to access the object while it is in used by a first thread, the second thread has to wait until the first thread completes its access.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAccessException
member.summary: Exception thrown when the calling thread does not have access to the object.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAccessException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the default error message.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAccessException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Deserialization constructor.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAccessException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a given error message.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAccessException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a given error message and inner exception.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAffineAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a type, ensures the instances of this type can only be accessed by the thread that created the instance. When a different thread accesses instances of this type, a exception is thrown.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAwareAttribute
member.summary: Base class for all aspects implementing threading models.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAwareAttribute.Advise(System.Object)
member.summary: Injects the advice into the child object.
member.returns: true if the children of have to be advised as well, false otherwise.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAwareAttribute.IsEligibleChild(System.Object,PostSharp.Patterns.Model.ChildInfo)
member.summary: Determines if an object is eligible to be a child of the target instance of the current aspect.
member.returns: true if is eligible to be a child without injecting any advice, otherwise false. When this method returns false, the aspect will the invoke the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAwareAttribute.OnSerializing(System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Requires read access level to the current object before serialization can proceed. This method will be introduced into the target class.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAwareAttribute.RuntimeVerificationEnabled
member.summary: Determines whether the code should be verified against the model at runtime. The default value is true for the debug build configuration and false for the release build configuration.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAwareAttributeTargetClass
member.summary: Describes the members that are consumed by the aspect. You can define one or many of these members in classes that are the target of to customize the behavior of the aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadAwareAttributeTargetClass.UseParentConcurrencyController(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the current object is should use the controller of the parent object.
member.param: The object to which the current object has been assigned as a child.
member.returns: true, if the current object will use the concurrency controller of , false, if it will its own concurrency controller.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingServices
member.summary: Exposes methods to work with the PostSharp.Patterns.Threading namespace.

member.name: E:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingServices.DeadlockDetected
member.summary: Event raised by implementation of the aspect.

member.name: E:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingServices.UnhandledException
member.summary: Event raised by the implementation of the , and aspects when an unhandled exception is encountered.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingServices.WithConcurrencyController(PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.IConcurrencyController)
member.summary: Sets the ambient concurrency controller for the current thread. Until the returned value is disposed, thread-aware objects created in the current thread will be assigned to the given concurrency controller.
member.param: The ambient concurrency controller. Use the class to create new concurrency controllers.
member.returns: A value representing the ambient concurrency controller context.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingUnhandledExceptionEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments of the event.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingUnhandledExceptionEventArgs.Exception
member.summary: Gets the exception.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingUnhandledExceptionEventArgs.IsHandled
member.summary: Determines whether the exception has been handled. Clients of the event must set this property to true if they handle the exception. Otherwise, the exception will be rethrown.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingUnhandledExceptionEventArgs.Source
member.summary: Gets the source component that caught the exception.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingUnhandledExceptionSource
member.summary: Enumeration of components that can raise the event.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingUnhandledExceptionSource.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadingUnhandledExceptionSource.Dispatch
member.summary: or .

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadMismatchException
member.summary: Exception thrown when a thread attempts to access an object that is affined to another thread.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadMismatchException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadMismatchException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new and sets the error message.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadMismatchException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new and sets the error message and the inner exception.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadSafetyPolicy
member.summary: When applied to an assembly, this policy will check for possible concurrency issues.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.ThreadUnsafeAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a type, ensures that only one thread executes in methods of this type. When more than one thread accesses methods of this type, a exception is thrown.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.UpgradeableReaderAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a method, specifies that the method requires read and write access to the object, but other threads are allowed to acquire read (but not write) access to the object until a method with the custom attribute is executed.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.WriterAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a method, specifies that the method requires write access to the object.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.YielderAttribute
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a method, specifies that the method that currently holds write access to the object (see ) allows other threads to read the object during the execution of the target method. This custom attribute is typically used on methods that raise events that must be processed synchronously by other threads.

summary.para: The class describes a threading model in which to methods are processed asynchronously from a single thread, suppressing concurrency inside each instance of the actor. To use the , apply the to a class.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.ActorThreadingModel.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Determines whether the threading model is possibly thread safe.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.FreezableThreadingModel
member.summary: The class describes a threading model where changes to an object are forbidden after the method has been called on this object. To use the , apply the custom attribute to a class.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.ImmutableThreadingModel
member.summary: The class describes a threading model where changes to an object are forbidden after completion of the object constructor. To use the , apply the custom attribute to a class.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.PrivateThreadingModel
member.summary: The class describes a behavior of objects in which their threading model is determined by the parent they are assigned to in a parent-child relationship. Objects with this threading model are considered a private state of their parent object and cannot be accessed from a different object.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.PrivateThreadingModel.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Determines whether the threading model is possibly thread safe.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.ReaderWriterSynchronizedThreadingModel
member.summary: The class describes a threading model where several threads can have concurrent read-only access, but where writing to the object requires exclusive access. To use the , apply the custom attribute to a class.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.ReaderWriterSynchronizedThreadingModel.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Determines whether the threading model is possibly thread safe.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.ReadOnlyThreadingModel
member.summary: Base class for and .

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.ReadOnlyThreadingModel.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Determines whether the threading model is possibly thread safe.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.SynchronizedThreadingModel
member.summary: The class describes a threading model where only a single thread can access the object at a time. To use the , apply the custom attribute to a class.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.SynchronizedThreadingModel.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Determines whether the threading model is possibly thread safe.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.ThreadAffineThreadingModel
member.summary: The class describes a threading model where only the thread that created the object has the right to access this object. To use the , apply the custom attribute to a class.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.ThreadUnsafeThreadingModel
member.summary: The class describes a threading model an object cannot be accessed concurrently by several threads. In case of concurrent access, a exception will be thrown. The thread-unsafe threading model is not strictly a model, because it cannot be deterministically verified. To use the , apply the custom attribute to a class.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Patterns.Threading.Models.ThreadUnsafeThreadingModel.IsThreadSafe
member.summary: Determines whether the threading model is possibly thread safe.
